revision.text:
'''''Worst-Case Scenario''''' is the name of a series of merchandise based on a 1999 book written by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht and published by [[Chronicle Books]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-100794592.html|title=NOW WHAT? 'WORST-CASE SCENARIO' AUTHORS HAVE ADVICE FOR MOST ANY SITUATION, FROM FLYING LEAPS TO ETERNAL MEETINGS.(DAYBREAK)|last=McKissack|first=Fred|date=April 27, 2003|work=The Wisconsin State Journal (Madison, WI) (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> The series first entry, ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook,'' sold over 10 million copies worldwide and prompted a series of related books, games, calendars, and two television series.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://quirkbooks.com/worst-case-scenario |title = Be prepared for the worst! |author = Anonymous |date = February 9, 2011 |work = Worst-Case Scenario |publisher = Quirk Books |location = Philadelphia PA |at = Featured Post |accessdate = January 26, 2012 |quote = With over 10 million books sold worldwide, it’s clear that the desire to be prepared is universal. }}</ref> Later works have been published via [[Quirk Books]] and has been credited with giving the company enough funding to expand.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/philadelphia/stories/2005/05/16/story4.html|title=Quirk books its wares in odd places|last=Van Allen|first=Peter|date=May 16, 2005|website=Philadelphia Business Journal|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-03-10}}</ref>
== Concept == A [[wikt:worst case scenario|worst-case scenario]] is the most severe possible outcome that can be projected to occur in a given situation. Conceiving of worst-case scenarios is a common form of strategic planning to prepare for and minimize contingencies that could result in accidents, quality problems, or other issues. The books provide instructions for situations like [[Emergency landing|landing a plane]] and surviving a [[shark attack]].
==Television series== There have been two television series that have been loosely based on the book series, a 2002 [[TBS (TV network)|TBS]] reality show and a 2010 [[survival skills]] [[television series]] on the [[Discovery Channel]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Piven|first1=Joshua|title=About|url=http://www.joshuapiven.com/about.html|publisher=Joshua Piven|accessdate=10 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-237048403.html|title=DStv.(Entertainment)|last=|first=|date=September 14, 2010|work=The Star (South Africa) (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> Both series ran for only one season.
===TBS (2002)=== The show ''Worst Case Scenarios'' ran on TBS from July 10, 2002 through November 13, 2002 and had a total of 13 episodes.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-84350983.html|title=TBS will bow 'Worst Case'.(reality show 'Worst-Case Scenario')(Brief Article)|last=Grego|first=Melissa|date=March 20, 2002|work=Variety (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-89924601.html|title=Worst Case Scenario. (Television Review).|last=Gallo|first=Phil|date=July 10, 2002|work=Variety (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> It was narrated by [[Mike Rowe (television host)|Mike Rowe]] and featured demonstrations by [[Stunt man|stunt men]] and [[Stunt woman|stunt women]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-9871298.html|title=Tune in tonight: Estrange yourself from this 'Big Brother'; 'Worst Case Scenario' is bad adaptation of book|last=McDonough|first=Kevin|date=July 10, 2002|work=Charleston Daily Mail (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> Each episode was hosted by new experts on how to survive worst-case scenarios. It also aired clips of real life situations, tips, volunteer challenges, and gadgets shown by Gear Girl ([[Danielle Burgio]]).
===Discovery Channel (2010)=== ''Worst-Case Scenario'' ran on the Discovery Channel beginning on May 5, 2010 and had a total of 12 episodes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://press.discovery.com/us/dsc/press-releases/2010/bear-grylls-worst-case-scenario/ |title=Bear Grylls' Worst Case Scenario : Discovery Press Web |publisher=Press.discovery.com |date=2010-01-14 |accessdate=2012-11-12}}</ref> It was hosted by [[Bear Grylls]], who was shown using skills he learned in the [[21 SAS]], which included [[self-defense]], evasive driving, [[parkour]], urban survival, and wilderness survival.
== Books ==
* ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-69309904.html|title=MALFUNCTIONING PARACHUTE GOT YOU DOWN? AUTHORS ARE THERE TO HELP.(Showcase)(Review)|last=Wineke|first=William R.|date=February 13, 2000|work=The Wisconsin State Journal (Madison, WI) (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-8618225.html|title=PREPARING FOR THE WORST|last=|first=|date=November 5, 2000|work=Boston Globe (subscription required)|access-date=March 10, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Travel'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Parenting'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and Sarah Jordan * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Weddings'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and Sarah Jordan * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: College'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and Jennifer Worick * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Dating and Sex'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and Jennifer Worick<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/lifestyles/sc-fam-0604-worst-date-scenario-20130604-story.html|title=Dating: The survival handbook|last=Hageman|first=William|date=|work=Chicago Tribune|access-date=2017-03-08|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}}</ref> * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Golf'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and James Grace * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Book of Survival Questions'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/978-0-8118-4539-7|title=Nonfiction Book Review: The Worst-Case Scenario Book of Survival Questions by Joshua Piven, Author, David Borgenicht, Author, Brenda Brown, Illustrator|last=|first=|date=|work=PublishersWeekly.com|access-date=2017-03-08|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: LIFE'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Holidays'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Work'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * "The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Paranormal" by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * "The Complete Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook" by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * "The Complete Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook: Man Skills" by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht
== Cards ==
* ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Cards'' * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Holiday Survival Cards: Stuck in Chimney'' * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Holiday Survival Cards: Unwanted Elves'' * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Holiday Cards: Reindeer Attack''
== Calendars == * ''The Worst-Case Scenario 2001 Survival Calendar: A Week-by-Week Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht {{ISBN|0-8118-2960-X}} * ''The Worst-Case Scenario 2006 Survival Calendar: A Week-by-Week Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario: Golf 2006 Daily Survival Calendar: A Day-by-Day Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril on the Green'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and James Grace * ''The Worst-Case Scenario 2007 Daily Survival Calendar: A Day-by-Day Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario 2007 Survival Calendar: A Week-by-Week Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario: Golf 2007 Daily Survival Calendar: A Day-by-Day Guide to Surviving a Year's Worth of Peril on the Green'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht
== Other media ==
* ''Worst-Case Scenario: Sticky Situation Notes'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Journal'' by Joshua Piven and David Borgenicht * ''The Worst-Case Scenario Dating & Sex Address Book'' by Joshua Piven, David Borgenicht, and Jennifer Worick
== In popular culture ==
* Artist [[Justin Sane]] wrote a song called "The Worst Case Survival Handbook" on his album ''[[Life, Love and the Pursuit of Justice]]''.
